intro: Ruehssia cubensis, commonly known as Cuban ruehssia, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to yellowish flowers. It produces small, dark berries that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. Ruehssia cubensis is often found in shaded, humid environments within its native range.
